H0.text: Tundra is land with permafrost, no trees, and small hardy plants.

H1.text: Subtropics is land with permafrost, no trees, and small hardy plants.

H2.text: Taiga is land with permafrost, no trees, and small hardy plants.

H3.text: Desert is land with permafrost, no trees, and small hardy plants.

A4.text: The soil there is frozen from 25 to 90 cm (10 to 35 in) down, making it impossible for trees to grow there.

A5.text: Arctic tundra occurs in the far Northern Hemisphere (Arctic), north of the taiga belt.
